brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to evaluate the effects of a feedback-system in psychotherapy on
      adult out-patients at a community mental health centre. It is hypothesized that the
      intervention will lead to more effective treatment, decreasing treatment dropout as well as
      improving patient-therapist relationship and patient activation in treatment.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Systematic Patient Feedback on Therapy Outcome

criteria.textblock:
The aim is to include a total of 128 patients.

        Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Referred for treatment of mental disorder(s)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Psychiatric emergency

          -  Poor/no understanding of Norwegian language

          -  Lack of ability to execute the practical procedures required for the project

intervention.description: The Partners for Change Outcome Management System, administered at the beginning and ending of every therapy session.

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Systematic Patient Feedback on Therapy Outcome and Dropout: A Randomized Controlled Study on Adult Out-patients at a Community Mental Health Centre.

other_outcome.description: Number of visits at general practitioner or other health services

overall_official.affiliation: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

oversight_info.authority: Norway:National Committee for Medical and Health Research Ethics

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Outcome Rating Scale and BASIS 32 and WHO-5
secondary_outcome.time_frame: T 0 (Week 1,start of treatment) and T4 (6 months, end of treatment)
T1 (1 month), T2 (2 months), T4 (6 months, end of treatment)
T1 (Week, start of treament) and T4 (6 months or end of treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Preferences for involvement in decision making

secondary_outcome.description: Patient Activation Measure Mental Health Questionnaire (13 items)

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
